title: How to Save a Document as an HTML File in a Plain Text Editor

steps.title: Open your code file.
steps.content: Open your code file. If your file is saved as a .txt file, it will open by default in Notepad for Windows. If your document isn't opening in Notepad, simply right-click the file, then click Open With > Notepad .

steps.title: Insert an HTML tag at the top of your document.
steps.content: Insert an HTML tag at the top of your document. Click into the top of your document and add a <html> tag on a new line.

steps.title: Insert a closing HTML tag at the top of your document.
steps.content: Insert a closing HTML tag at the top of your document. Click into the bottom of your document and add a </html> tag on a new line.

steps.title: Open the Save dialogue.
steps.content: Open the Save dialogue. To do this, click File > Save As .

steps.title: Save as an html or htm file.
steps.content: Save as an html or htm file. When saving your code, you can enter any file name you like, but type .html or .htm after the file name. Ensure the file type dropdown is set to All Files or HTML .

steps.title: Open your file to make sure it opens properly.
steps.content: Open your file to make sure it opens properly. When you open the new version of your code, it will look like a website that applies the HTML you've written to the page. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Open your code file.
steps.content: Open your code file. If your file is saved as a .txt file, it will open by default in TextEdit on a Mac. If your document isn't opening in TextEdit, simply control-click the file, then click Open With > TextEdit .

steps.title: Insert an HTML tag at the top of your document.
steps.content: Insert an HTML tag at the top of your document. Click into the top of your document and add a <html> tag on a new line.

steps.title: Insert a closing HTML tag at the top of your document.
steps.content: Insert a closing HTML tag at the top of your document. Click into the bottom of your document and add a </html> tag on a new line.

steps.title: Open the Save dialogue.
steps.content: Open the Save dialogue. To do this, click File > Save As .

steps.title: Save as an html or htm file.
steps.content: Save as an html or htm file. When saving your code, you can enter any file name you like, but type .html or .htm after the file name. Ensure the file type dropdown is set to All Files or HTML .

steps.title: Open your file to make sure it opens properly.
steps.content: Open your file to make sure it opens properly. When you open the new version of your code, it will look like a website that applies the HTML you've written to the page.

steps.title: Go to the CloudConvert website.
steps.content: Go to the CloudConvert website. CloudConvert is a free website that allows you to convert files into other file types.

steps.title: Choose TXT in the first dropdown.
steps.content: Choose TXT in the first dropdown. It's on the right-hand side of the webpage, next to the word "convert." The TXT option is under the "Document" section.

steps.title: Choose HTML in the second dropdown.
steps.content: Choose HTML in the second dropdown. It's on the right next to the first dropdown, separated by the word "to." The HTML option is under the "Document" section.

steps.title: Click the red Select File button.
steps.content: Click the red Select File button. If you click the Select File button itself, the webpage will open a dialog box where you can choose a file from your computer. If you click the arrow next to Select File , you can choose a different way to upload your file.

steps.title: Choose the file you want to upload.
steps.content: Choose the file you want to upload. If you want to convert multiple files at once, click Add more files at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click Convert.
steps.content: Click Convert . It will take a few seconds for your file to be converted to HTML.

steps.title: Click Download once your file is converted.
steps.content: Click Download once your file is converted. Your .txt file has now been converted to .html and can be used in website applications.
